title: Bump ndarray
body: In `hdf5` I updated so ndarray 0.16 is supported, and this PR follows suite

title: docs: point to new hdf5-rust fork with example patch section
Add and use Extents type
body:
Adds the Extents type which should make selecting data a bit more ergonomic.

This mirrors the API of the netcdf and hdf5 crates (more or less copy-paste ;) ) but is tailored to the assumptions of this crate (i.e. no strides).

This contains major breaking API changes.

title: ci: run tests on win and macosx
Index ncdf groups and subgroups
Add convenient NetCDF indexing methods
body:
- tests: more debug
- netcdf: add convenience methods for indexing a NetCDF file

I have not added `index` or `TryFrom` implementations on the `netcdf::Variable` because we don't have direct access to the `hdf5::Dataset` and we do not know what group the variable exists in.

Tests sporadically fail unless run with `--test-threads 1`, @magnusuMET any idea on how to enable the global lock on the hdf5 lib? Compiling with `static`.

Ref: https://github.com/georust/netcdf/issues/42#issuecomment-1709618920

title: Update hdf5
body: This upgrades the hdf5 to something which is more upstreamed, with the only patch being the one to include and build hdf5 1.14 from source.

title: test: test norkyst files between hdf5 and hidefix
ci: remove duplicate ubuntu tests target
python, io-uring, parallel reading
body:
- set up python bindings
- update python setup

title: Change to custom fork of hdf5
body: This fork applies some fixes which are waiting for merge and vendors hdf5-c by copying the files and not using a git module. Since libgit2 does not support shallow clones, build times are outrageous since we have to pull the entire hdf5-c git tree 3 times per clean build

title: Simple cleanup
body: Removing lots of unsafe, speeding up the benchmarks in the process

title: Replace Travis CI with Github Actions
update to hdf5 0.8, not using custom hdf5 library
